brewery.brewery_description: For the last 30 years we have been at the heart of the Scottish Craft Beer scene, long before there even was one. From reviving ancient recipes, such as Scotland's Original Craft Beer; Fraoch Heather Ale, to our innovative Totemic Tall boy range, we remain fiercely independent and true to our core values.

venue.venue_name: ibis Edinburgh Centre South Bridge - Royal Mile

beer.beer_style: Historical Beer - Gruit / Ancient Herbed Ale

items.badge_description: While spontaneity can be fun, sometimes you want to make sure your adventure will rock. Checkout the menu at an Untappd Verified Venue before visiting and know exactly what’s on tap! That's 95 check-ins at venue that is verified. Try 5 more for Level 20!
We believe in IPA and you should too. You certainly have a taste for the hops! That's 35 different IPAs. Try 5 more for Level 8! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast

items.checkin_comment: Doet wel wat zomers aan, maar niet heel tropisch zoals het blik aangeeft.

beer.beer_description: The Head Honcho of the Totemic Range, this tribal IPA is pale & powerfull with heavy hitting tropical notes. Unfiltered & naturally hazy.

There's at least one in every pack and this is our very own agent of chaos. Created from a complex layer of malts and blended hops, this well balanced IPA delivers satisfaction every time. Golden in the glass, fruity on the nose with hints of cedar. Joker IPA is Bitter/Sweet, full of flavour and is sure to put a smile on your face.
This Extra Pale Ale is an assertive blend of US hops. Through aromas of pine, a tomahawk hit of soft ripe & tropical fruit explodes on the palate.

items.badge_description: Unlike The Highlander from TV, there are more than just one brewery in Scotland fighting the great craft beer war. Join the battle. No kilt required. Try 5 more for Level 47.

beer.beer_description: This Extra Pale Ale is an assertive blend of US hops. Through aromas of pine, a tomahawk hit of soft ripe & tropical fruit explodes on the palate.
Guapo - good looking, great tasting. We have wrestled as much flavour into this micro IPA as we possibly could. Tropically hoppy with juicy undertones and a crisp lemony finish.

items.checkin_comment: Resinous, piney and bitter on a malty backbone. A Scottish take in a wcipa and I'm good with it.

beer.beer_description: How do you improve on a stone-cold classic? Double it up of course... bitter-sweet with a big US hop punch, Double Joker is the bigger, stronger brother of our legendary Joker IPA: a bold Scottish style Imperial IPA generously hopped & devilishly flavoursome.

user.bio: I literally take photos of beer and post them on the internet, how did my life go so wrong?

beer.beer_description: Roisin is our very own fruit beer. We brew a light, crisp blonde ale and add bucket loads of fresh Tayberries in the cold storage tank and leave the two to mingle for 3 weeks.The Tayberry is a cross between a Raspberry & a Blackberriy, (relative of the American 'Loganberry'). The fruit is named after the Tay region in which it is grown. Roisin pours champagne pink with sweet hop & berry aromas which also carry through to the taste, with a satisfyingly tart finish.

items.badge_description: Canning is all the rage and it's not hard to see why - travels well, more environmentally friendly, and no need to carry your bottle opener. That's 300 checkins with the serving style of Can. Try 5 more for Level 61! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast
Unlike The Highlander from TV, there are more than just one brewery in Scotland fighting the great craft beer war. Join the battle. No kilt required. Try 5 more for Level 19.

beer.beer_description:
This American style IPA achieves a delicate balance of flavour and hoppiness, delivering taste and textures without being overly strong- and shouldn’t give you a hangover as bad as Romulan Ale will!
Live long and prosper

items.badge_description: Canning is all the rage and it's not hard to see why - travels well, more environmentally friendly, and no need to carry your bottle opener. That's 390 checkins with the serving style of Can. Try 5 more for Level 79! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast

beer.beer_description: There's at least one in every pack and this is our very own agent of chaos. Created from a complex layer of malts and blended hops, this well balanced IPA delivers satisfaction every time. Golden in the glass, fruity on the nose with hints of cedar. Joker IPA is Bitter/Sweet, full of flavour and is sure to put a smile on your face.

items.badge_description: Fresh from the tap is one of the best ways to enjoy a beer. Just try to use a glass and not drink directly from the tap, as tempting as it may be. That's 130 checkins with the serving style of Draft. Try 5 more for Level 27!

beer.beer_description: Dark traditional malty pale ale

items.badge_description: Unlike The Highlander from TV, there are more than just one brewery in Scotland fighting the great craft beer war. Join the battle. No kilt required. Try 5 more for Level 33.

beer.beer_description: This Lager/IPA hybrid is a revolution in refreshment and flavour. All the crisp clean notes of the finest lager but with the discrete bitter finish of a well balanced IPA. It's not confused about what it wants' to be, it's just the best of both worlds.
This Extra Pale Ale is an assertive blend of US hops. Through aromas of pine, a tomahawk hit of soft ripe & tropical fruit explodes on the palate.

venue.venue_name: ibis Edinburgh Centre South Bridge - Royal Mile

items.checkin_comment: I enjoyed this lil east coast boy

beer.beer_description: Mystic River runs gold with haze for days. A combo of juicy hops are layered on a base of malt, wheat & oats delivering a light grainy sweetness & an abundance of tropical fruit & citrus.

items.badge_description: You may not be able to see through the haze, but that juicy, hoppy goodness goes down smooth. What started as a trend is here to stay. That's 30 different beers with the style of IPA - New England / Hazy, Pale Ale - New England / Hazy, IPA - Milkshake, or Pale Ale - Milkshake. Try 5 more for Level 7!

beer.beer_description: Silver Lake shines pale & gold. Floral hop aromas are backed up by punchy pine & citrus. Bitter up front but balanced by a touch of malt sweetness, delivering a satisfying dry finish. Gluten Free (tested below 20ppm)

There's at least one in every pack and this is our very own agent of chaos. Created from a complex layer of malts and blended hops, this well balanced IPA delivers satisfaction every time. Golden in the glass, fruity on the nose with hints of cedar. Joker IPA is Bitter/Sweet, full of flavour and is sure to put a smile on your face.

This Lager/IPA hybrid is a revolution in refreshment and flavour. All the crisp clean notes of the finest lager but with the discrete bitter finish of a well balanced IPA. It's not confused about what it wants' to be, it's just the best of both worlds.

beer.beer_style: Historical Beer - Gruit / Ancient Herbed Ale
beer.beer_description: The Original Craft Beer; brewed in Scotland since 2000 B.C. The Brotherhood have been guardians of the ancient Gaelic recipe for "leann fraoich" (heather ale) since 1988 and are proud to be the only brewery still producing this unique style of beer and distributing it world wide.  A light amber ale with floral peaty aroma, full malt character, and a spicy herbal finish - This beer allows you to literally pour 4000 years of Scottish history into a glass.

Brewed for the summer evenings when we down tools for the day and retire to the beer garden; this bright, golden ale is a blend of pale malt, cascade and bobek hops with a late infusion of fresh elderflowers and lemon zest. Fruity, aromatic and deliciously refreshing. Additional hops of First Gold and Amarillo.
A rich, red, brewery conditioned ale with fruity/toffee malt character and strong citrusy hop aromas.

A blend of 7 grains, 3 hop strains and a late infusion of Elderflower & Lemon: This aromatic _IPA_ was named by Scott's daughter. It pours a deep gold with aroma's of elderflower and citrus hops, followed by sweet caramel. On the tongue the biscuity malts are perfectly balanced with the bitterness of the hops, freshness of the lemon & lingering floral elderflower aftertaste. An extraordinary brew.
It pours a deep gold with aroma's of elderflower and citrus hops, followed by sweet caramel. On the tounge the biscuity malts are perfectly balanced with the bitterness of the hops, freshness of the lemon & lingering floral elderflower aftertaste. An extraordinary brew.

This creamy dark stout, deep chocolate in colour has a nose of roast malts, coffee, liquorice & orange peel. The aromas carry on into the flavour with a smooth mouthfeel, rich malty start, fresh hoppy middle & a delicious lingering sweet orange after taste. Sure to get you marching again on those cold winter evenings.

Introduced by the Vikings, spruce and pine ales were very popular in the Scottish Highlands until the end of the 19th century.

Many early explorers, including Captain Cook, used spruce ale during long sea voyages since it prevented scurvy and ill health.

Shetland spruce ale was said to "stimulate animal instincts" and give you twins.

Alba is a triple style ale brewed to a traditional Highland recipe from Scots pine and spruce shoots pickled during early spring. Pure malted barley, is boiled with the young sprigs of pine for several hours then the fresh shoots of the spruce are added for a short infusion before fermentation.

MALTS: British Pale Ale Malt, Crystal Malt, Malted Wheat

HOPS: First Gold

ADDITIONAL: Pine, Spruce, Bogmyrtal

beer.beer_style: Historical Beer - Gruit / Ancient Herbed Ale
beer.beer_description: Elderberry ale has formed part of the Celtic tradition since it was introduced by Welsh druids in the 9th century, where the ale was passed around people of the village during the Autumn festival. Our recipe was taken from a 16th century record of domestic drinking in the Scottish Highlands and is Brewed with roasted barley and chocolate malt, then infused with elderberries to deliver a dark, rich, fruity beer with a strong single hop aroma and satisfying bitter conclusion.
This Extra Pale Ale is an assertive blend of US hops. Through aromas of pine, a tomahawk hit of soft ripe & tropical fruit explodes on the palate.

beer.beer_style: Historical Beer - Gruit / Ancient Herbed Ale
beer.beer_description: Grozet: "the most convivial of ales" as described (and often imbibed) by 'The Bard' himself has become the adopted beer of the bohemian vagabonds of the Scottish arts scene. A Pale golden brew, that is cold stored with gooseberries to deliver a sharp refreshing drinking experience.

An instant classic: Our spiced porter, pours as black as the Midnight Sun and is created from a blend of malted barley, oats, roast barley, chocolate malt then balanced with a generous helping of hops. An after bite of fresh root ginger elevates this ale to another level. The flavours are as paradoxical as the name.

MALTS: British Pale Ale Malt, Oats, Roast Barley, Chocolate Malt.

HOPS: First Gold, Fuggles
Rubus is a classic IPA, enhanced by a natural burst of grapefruit flavour - refreshing & bitter to the end! A William Brothers Brewing Co. beer sold exclusively in Aldi Stores UK.

Blood orange IPA. Otis is a big, bold, blood orange IPA a blend of 5 malts are quenched by Cascade, Citra, Mosaic, and Chinook hops, then crushed with bitter orange to deliver a juicy, citrus, bitting clear beer.

Exclusive to Aldi Stores.

The first in our 'Chapeau' series, where we celebrate the talents of up & coming brewers, tweaking their recipes and making them available to a wider audience. Black in colour with full, floral, fruity aromas and a huge roasted malt character that gives way to a profanely dry hopped finish. It's the nelson sauvin hops that deliver the bitter end.

This Mayan inspired brew is a mocha lover's delight: a blend of ethically sourced coffees from around the world combine with cacao nibs to deliver an intense stout for the ages.

Lactose free and vegan friendly!

How do you improve on a stone-cold classic? Double it up of course... bitter-sweet with a big US hop punch, Double Joker is the bigger, stronger brother of our legendary Joker IPA: a bold Scottish style Imperial IPA generously hopped & devilishly flavoursome.
The Head Honcho of the Totemic Range, this tribal IPA is pale & powerfull with heavy hitting tropical notes. Unfiltered & naturally hazy.

Prior to the 1850's Scottish coastal alehouses brewed with malted barley, grown in fields fertilised by seaweed. This environment gave the barley a very specific flavour which we recreate by the inclusion of fresh seaweed in the mash tun. A rich dark chocolate ale, which has the aroma of a fresh Scottish sea breeze and a distinctive malty texture.

Celebrating the classic era of Disco; Studio 54 pours golden and glittering and struts with with a hop forward profile, delivered by Magnum for bittering, Citra and Chinook in the whirlpool and a hop rocket addition of Simcoe.  

Brewed exclusively for ALDI.

Six States is a New England White IPA, with a juicy tropical fruit aroma, balanced by the refreshing, spicy addition of citrus peel & a pinch of coriander seed.

Heavily dry hopped with a restrained bitterness it delivers a smoother, rounder flavour which, combined with the presence of wheat & oats results in a full body and natural haze.

EXCLUSIVE TO ALDI UK STORES.
Low man on the totem pole; this gluten free lager delivers a totally tropical explosion of guava gratification.

This clean, cool West Coast IPA is brewed with a US ale yeast & pours golden in the glass. A slightly sweet malt character builds before unleashing a citrus burst from a classic combination of Citra, Mosaic & Chinook hops.
(Translation: The Black Dog) - A crisp & refreshing classic pilsner with a zesty twist of Seville Orange to deliver a subtle fruity citrus bite. Brewed especially to be enjoyed with food.
Perfect Storm is a delicous light IPA; full bodied with striking bitterness and intense fruity hop character derived from a blend of Mosaic, Cascade & Southern Cross hops.
